measure.name: create_bar_from_building_type_ratios
measure.display_name: Create Bar From Building Type Ratios
measure.description: Creates one or more rectangular building elements based on space type ratios of selected mix of building types, along with user arguments that describe the desired geometry characteristics.
measure.modeler_description: The building floor area can be described as a footprint size or as a total building area. The shape can be described by its aspect ratio or can be defined as a set width. Because this measure contains both DOE and DEER inputs, care needs to be taken to choose a template compatable with the selected building types. See readme document for additional guidance.

argument.name: bldg_type_a_num_units
argument.display_name: Primary Building Type Number of Units
argument.description: Number of units argument not currently used by this measure

argument.name: bldg_type_b_fract_bldg_area
argument.display_name: Building Type B Fraction of Building Floor Area

argument.name: bldg_type_b_num_units
argument.display_name: Building Type B Number of Units
argument.description: Number of units argument not currently used by this measure

argument.name: bldg_type_c_fract_bldg_area
argument.display_name: Building Type C Fraction of Building Floor Area

argument.name: bldg_type_c_num_units
argument.display_name: Building Type C Number of Units
argument.description: Number of units argument not currently used by this measure

argument.name: bldg_type_d_fract_bldg_area
argument.display_name: Building Type D Fraction of Building Floor Area

argument.name: bldg_type_d_num_units
argument.display_name: Building Type D Number of Units
argument.description: Number of units argument not currently used by this measure

argument.name: single_floor_area
argument.description: Non-zero value will fix the single floor area, overriding a user entry for Total Building Floor Area

argument.name: floor_height
argument.description: Selecting a typical floor height of 0 will trigger a smart building type default.

argument.name: custom_height_bar
argument.description: This is argument value is only relevant when smart default floor to floor height is used for a building type that has spaces with custom heights.

argument.name: building_rotation
argument.description: Set Building Rotation off of North (positive value is clockwise). Rotation applied after geometry generation. Values greater than +/- 45 will result in aspect ratio and party wall orientations that do not match cardinal directions of the inputs.

argument.name: ns_to_ew_ratio
argument.display_name: Ratio of North/South Facade Length Relative to East/West Facade Length
argument.description: Selecting an aspect ratio of 0 will trigger a smart building type default. Aspect ratios less than one are not recommended for sliced bar geometry, instead rotate building and use a greater than 1 aspect ratio.

argument.name: perim_mult
argument.description: Selecting a value of 0 will trigger a smart building type default. This represents a multiplier for the building perimeter relative to the perimeter of a rectangular building that meets the area and aspect ratio inputs. Other than the smart default of 0.0 this argument should have a value of 1.0 or higher and is only applicable Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced division method.

argument.name: bar_width
argument.description: Non-zero value will fix the building width, overriding user entry for Perimeter Multiplier. NS/EW Aspect Ratio may be limited based on target width.

argument.name: bar_sep_dist_mult
argument.description: Multiplier of separation between bar elements relative to building height.

argument.name: wwr
argument.description: Selecting a window to wall ratio of 0 will trigger a smart building type default.

argument.name: party_wall_fraction
argument.display_name: Fraction of Exterior Wall Area with Adjacent Structure
argument.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition.

argument.name: party_wall_stories_north
argument.display_name: Number of North facing stories with party wall
argument.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior north walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

argument.name: party_wall_stories_south
argument.display_name: Number of South facing stories with party wall
argument.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior south walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

argument.name: party_wall_stories_east
argument.display_name: Number of East facing stories with party wall
argument.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior east walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

argument.name: party_wall_stories_west
argument.display_name: Number of West facing stories with party wall
argument.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior west walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

argument.name: bottom_story_ground_exposed_floor
argument.display_name: Is the Bottom Story Exposed to Ground
argument.description: This should be true unless you are modeling a partial building which doesn't include the lowest story. The bottom story floor will have an adiabatic boundary condition when false.

argument.name: top_story_exterior_exposed_roof
argument.display_name: Is the Top Story an Exterior Roof
argument.description: This should be true unless you are modeling a partial building which doesn't include the highest story. The top story ceiling will have an adiabatic boundary condition when false.

argument.name: make_mid_story_surfaces_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Make Mid Story Floor Surfaces Adiabatic
argument.description: If set to true, this will skip surface intersection and make mid story floors and celings adiabatic, not just at multiplied gaps.

argument.name: bar_division_method
argument.display_name: Division Method for Bar Space Types
argument.description: To use perimeter multiplier greater than 1 selected Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced.
argument.default_value: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced

choice.value: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
choice.display_name: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced

choice.value: Single Space Type - Core and Perimeter
choice.display_name: Single Space Type - Core and Perimeter

argument.name: double_loaded_corridor
argument.description: Add double loaded corridor for building types that have a defined circulation space type, to the selected space types.

argument.name: use_upstream_args
argument.description: When true this will look for arguments or registerValues in upstream measures that match arguments from this measure, and will use the value from the upstream measure in place of what is entered for this measure.

argument.name: climate_zone
argument.description: Climate Zone argument is not used by this measure
